comments.body: Should this be done at construction time rather than when called (since it's supposed to be an immutable snapshot?). Or maybe checking _exampleManifest?
I agree, `hasExampleApp` should not check `example/pubspec.yaml` on-the-fly as it muddles the snapshot semantics. I'll find a better way.
Leaving it to another PR, as "a better way" entails more changes.

What will happen after running `flutter materialize`? I thought that was the whole reason to have two types from the beginning.
I guess the different subdirectories can be made to point into `android/blah/` and `.android/foo` respectively, but `AndroidProject.directory` becomes ambiguous.
But then again, perhaps we never use it on the outside (in that case it should be made private).

Yes, I'll work towards encapsulating it as I implement `materialize`. The idea is that any external code in need of the `directory` getter on `AndroidProject` or `IosProject` should ask for help instead of information, countering "feature envy".
I believe I'm following the style guide here: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Style-guide-for-Flutter-repo#separate-the-if-expression-from-its-statement
FWIW internally we already switched to hand-written `index.html`. We consider it equivalent of Java/ObjC code generated by `flutter create` then edited by hand.
Makes sense, we can generate the index.html only as a part of flutter create and then separate out the generatedPluginRegistry files.
